p.s: The film, but also the book, maked me thinking a lot about life.
First the topic of the film gave me a bigger look on racism and how common this theme in the whole world is.
Second the film's message got really close to me to be brave.
It says that everyone can and should be brave.
Everyone should not stay quiet when something happens, because that will not solve any problems.
In addition to that to me it got clear that I have a really good life.

Of course I have problems and stress, too, like exams, pupertypuberty of finding my way, but other people at my age have much more and harder problems to deal with, so I should be thankful for that what I have.
Another impact is the advice to make always the best of every situation, no matter how hard it is.
Like Starr did it, she never gave up.
Finally the last thing that I learned is that family stays forever and if you have a lovely family it is more worth it to hold on to them, than the most things.
I think it was really impressive to see Starr with her family and how they supported and how the protected each other.
